content.description:
An easy, kinda dirty slab leads into a mini roof and the steep section of great black rock. This route has some very fun moves!

Ends at the midway anchor, or can be linked into Killer Beez to the top.
content.location: The left hand line on the lower Bee Wall that takes the black streak through the mini roof.

content.description: Climb the slab corner just left of Bee Yourself for a couple bolts till reaching the the break beneath the steep, black streaked overhang. There are three routes on the bulge, this is the middle one. Clip the fourth bolt and commit to 20ft of powerful climbing up a juggy seam capped by a hard pull off of a two-finger pocket. Mantle the bulge, clip the chains, and stare up at the harder second pitch...
content.protection: 7 bolts to anchor. Slings on lower bolts help with drag if trying the upper pitch.
content.location: A tree provides shade for the belayer underneath the Beehive Wall, which is towards the north (climber's left) of Main Crag. The line takes the seam splitting the streaked, usually shady overhang.

content.description:
Follow a faint, slabby seam littered with holds up a mossy slab to a break. Stem up to a corner crack and mantle out left to a great position on an exposed corner. Two steep bulges above separated by a rest gets you to a giant ledge with anchors in the roof.

*This is a brand-new route and is still a bit dirty (Aug.'19).

*Can be linked into Point Break (10a) with 20 draws and a few slings for a long 5.10 mega pitch (2 raps).
content.location: Right and just uphill of Sully's Route, behind a small tree.

content.description: Long slab to bulge route, with a good bit of “in your face” climbing. The crux at the second bulge clocks in at 5.12- if you’re 6ft+, otherwise this might feel like 5.12+. Shares anchors with "Keep it under 100." Tie a knot in the end of your rope if using a 60m, and beware some loose stuff at the bottom.
content.location: Climbs the gray slab towards a small black streak up to an alcove on the left edge of the steep Bee Wall, then trends right along a seam and finishes in the large vertical crack to the top of the wall.

content.description: One of the easier climbs at Allenspur this climb sees a lot of traffic as a place to hang a top rope or just hang out in the little cove that is filled with several good lines.  Sadly this is not one of those good lines IMO.  The bolting is extremely weird with some of the bolts being placed behind boulders and the like.  That being said though the pitches above are fantastic and if you don't feel like doing the far superior Sully's just to the right this is a way to get to the anchors for those climbs.
content.protection: Bolts with Rap anchor up top.
content.location: The first climb you come upon when you walk up into the small alcove.  Starts on a column.

content.description: Climb the first five bolts of “Keep It Under 100” and cut to the right. Follow pockets, crimps, and jugs up the perfect gray slab to cross over the second-to-last bolt of “100” and finish straight up to mussy hook anchors. Full on slab climbing!
content.location: Starts on the slab to the left of the steep Bee Wall. Belay next to a downed tree on the trail.

content.description:
P1: Climb the obvious bolt line right of "

Todos

" which surmounts the large overhang.  The crux is pulling the lip of the roof.  The climb is much easier than it looks due to massive jugs through the overhang.

P2: The second pitch traverses right and is substantially harder, probably 10d or 11a. It is also airy and committing. Not a tope rope due to the traverse so belay off the tree at the top and rappel down the chains to the left.
content.protection:
8 bolts shares anchor with the route

Todos

. Use runners at 2nd and 6th bolts.
content.location: The route begins just behind the nice shady juniper.  Rappel descent.

content.description: Decent, wandery climbing up flaky, uninspiring rock that gets good right at the top. Don't pull too hard.
content.location: The lone route that climbs the black slab up to the vertical face just right of the guano corner.

content.description: A shameless linkup that starts on Shady Business and cuts right along the edge of the giant roof. Steep and powerful meets thin and techy, with a fun finish on the upper goods of “Business”.
content.protection: 11 bolts to mussy hooks. Sling bolt one.
content.location: Left side of the giant roof on the far left side of Main Crag.

content.description: The route climbs just left of the prow up a stem corner on the shady side of the wall. The climb is unique and has a great position. There are good rests between the bouldery cruxes.
content.location:
The climb is located on the far left side of the

Main Crag

.

content.description: Great route! Starts off with a funky boulder problem unless you use the other wall behind you. Moves up in precarious movement to a giant jug feature. Move up and to the right onto a heady layback sequence (crux) to easier moves above to the anchors. Definitely worth doing if you're in the area.
content.location: Once passing the short steep section in the approach trail, head up and right into an alcove with a cave in the back. This route is the first bolted line just left of the cave.

content.description: The bolt line just to the right of Beach Break, this line goes just to the left of the large overhang.  If I had to choose between this and Beach Break I would choose it as the bottom is more aesthetic.  If rapping off the anchors for Sully's a 70M rope is required.
content.location: Climb either Sully's or Todo's to access this route with the start differing on which route you take.  Head out on the large grassy ledge below the overhang to find the start.

content.description: Climbs up a prow to a bulge (crux) and continue above.
content.location:
This line is to the right of

Hannukah Valentine

and left of

Paint the Bottle

.

content.description: Two cruxes, technical at the bottom and endurance at the top.  One of the longest pitches at the Spur.  Can be broken up into two pitches using chains halfway for those with shorter ropes.  A 70 meter rope is ideal, but you can use a 60 to lower with some down-climbing.
content.location:
Route goes up the middle of the

Main Wall

to the right of the big roofs.  Scurry around from the right to find the belay perch.

content.description: The righter of the two lines on the slab to the left of Todo's, this route goes through a couple of bulges up to chains.
content.location: Up in the small alcove, this is the route just to the left of Todos.

content.description: Clip the first four bolts of "Hermes HS" and cut right to a rest stance under a small roof. Crank out on underclings (reachy crux) and keep it together on cool features to the top. Stick clip and helmet recommended.
content.location: Farthest route to the right on Main, up and around the backside.

content.description: First half is a fun friction slab that is as much a mind game as anything. Tough to wrap your brain around it once you hit the second bolt and realize the significance of the name. Trust your rubber and find those little finger pockets and crimpers! Ends on a standing ledge so you can take your time getting into the chains.
content.protection: 6 bolts to chains. A couple longer draws to help with drag is a good idea.
content.location: Once passing the short steep section in the approach trail, head up and right into an alcove with a cave in the back. This route is the first bolted line just right of the cave.

content.description: This is the right-hand second pitch above the lower Bee Wall. Hard clips, steep bouldering with a little dyno, and of course some dicey slab will test all of your skills on this one. Four bolts of intense will get you to the committing rockover move at the lip of the upper slab to a very thankful rest position. Keep it together for one final test and finish on jugs at the very top of the cliff.
content.protection: 6 bolts on the upper pitch, all currently fixed. Slings or long draws on the very bottom of the first pitch. Mussy hook anchor.
content.location: Right hand second pitch to any of the lower Bee Wall routes, takes the upper headwall just left of the hanging beehive.

content.description: A fun slab leads to a short roof crack crux and a rest. From there, follow a broken, blocky corner straight up for several bolts until you transfer onto the face. Follow the slanting crack up and far, far right across Sunday Driver to chains with Mussy hooks at the top of a crack.
content.location: Starts on the black slab next to a crack. Belay next to a downed tree on the trail.

content.description: Climb through the low angle stuff up to some small roofs, easily passed on the right. (This bottom half will clean up with some traffic.) Now you are at the headwall crux. I climbed it (the crux) right of the bolts, kind of a thin crack to work off of. Exciting finish to the top.
content.location: Immediately left of Blood and Bolts.

content.description:
Route is just right of

First Light

and shares same anchors.  Could use some more cleaning.  Wear a helmet!

This one is an instant classic which took some serious excavation.  Start off of paradise ledge and the climb is lookers left of

Paradise

.  Mostly moderate climbing until the power layback at the top.  Bolted well.

Tip-toe up 10ft of choss to reach the first bolt, then head right or left and balance your way up 3 more bolts to reach the obvious left-trending crack. From here, you may choose to jam, layback or face climb to the anchors just below the giant roof.
content.location: Located on the far right side of the Main Crag, directly underneath a giant triangular roof. Stays dry in the rain.

content.description: Climb on easy broken ledges past some vegetation to a steep grey slab.
content.location:
At the

Main Crag

, to the right of

Cold Feet

and left of

Poacher's Pinch.

content.description: Two bolts of slab take you to a giant sidepull jug and a clip in the roof, followed by the first crux. Find your sequence and traverse left to the crack and a rest, followed by another crux sequence getting over the next bulge to a rest. Relax and quest up and left, with an exposed crossover on the arete to the dark side and the top of the cliff.
content.protection: 13 bolts to mussy hooks. A few long draws down low and a sling after the first roof might be good.
content.location: Last route all the way down on the left side before you go around the corner. Starts below the giant roof and traverses left along the lip, finishing at the top of the dark slabby face.

content.description: Follow 3 bolts up a ramp to the large ledge, then crack climb and stem the corner system up enjoyable features, spacey bolts and comfortable stances. After a major cleaning effort, the first route ever done at the Spur is good to go. However, as with any new route at the Spur I would recommend a belay helmet. Retro-bolted with permission.
content.location: Left of "Keep it under 100." Follows the major corner system.

content.description: Climb the awesome finger crack in the dihedral to the undercling crack lining the roof. Reach over the lip to the hidden 'jug', clip the bolt and crank the finger locks to an airy finish.
content.location: Just right of Happy Boschday, far right side of Main Crag

content.description:
A dirty slab leads to a transfer right onto the wavy face. Climb the crack feature (crux), and cruise to the anchor. This line was intended to be longer, but the slab above didn't work; hence, the anchor stops this thing shorter than you want it to be. Makes for a decent warmup that stays in the shade most of the day.

In memory of Travis Swanson, who passed on Mt. Cowen the day before this went in.
content.location: Farthest left route on the Main Crag, literally on the edge of the wall.

content.description: This line tackles the steepest most exposed section of the main crag.  Begin by scrambling up to dirty bird ledge where you will find a bolt to clip in to.  The route follows Detached Retina then traverses left and then straight up through the roofs.
content.protection: Use long runners on all bolts!  You can lower only with a 70m rope.

content.description: The bolts are spacious so be prepared for some flight time. Climb straight off dirty bird ledge. Need a 70 m rope to lower.
Goes past a few bolts up a slab, then over a bulge (crux) and continues to anchors.
content.location:
Main crag, to the right of

Blood and Bolts

.

climbs.name: Climbing Club Route
climbs.fa: Hermes Lynn and Park High Climbing Club

content.description:
Follow the crack system.  Route is just right of

Blood and Bolts

,  a good beginner lead.
content.protection: 12 bolts to anchor with 2 perma draws

content.description: Look for a small crystalline cave about 10 feet up, the route starts about 10 feet left of that.  There are 2 cruxes, first is a small bulge just be fore a "v" shaped section, the second is about 4 (or so) clips form the top it gets steep there and the holds thin out a bit.
content.protection: 12 clips to chains. Very well bolted.
content.location: Depending on what guide book you have, it the first on the list or the 6th route.  When approaching from the new access go past "Look Ma" and "Cold Feet". After the switch backs its the first route you come too.

content.description: Exposed, committing, and pumpy. Traverse right along a jug rail way out in space for two bolts (slings), then continue straight up through multiple overlaps, joining up with the finger crack underclings of Sully's second pitch to the top of the wall. Lots of air and spacey bolts. Not a top rope: belay up second from chain anchor.
content.location: First bolt is directly above Wave Hog anchor and heads right along the lip of the giant roof. Belay from ledge (belay bolt).  Rappel from Point Break anchors or walk off climbers' right.

content.description: A long and varied route with steep, fun moves. Getting through the last three bolts is the crux, but surmounting the first mini-roof might make you puzzle.
content.location: Left portion of Main Crag. Starts to the right of a faint seam, follows line to the right of the Bee Hive.

content.description: Follows the left most line of bolts after climbing either Sully's or Todos to access the base.  Interesting climbing up small edges/seams with the occasional pinch.  Really fun!
content.protection: Bolts with chain anchor up top.
content.location: Climb either Sully's or Todo's and follow the left most bolts.
